definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: We feel the long pulsation, ebb and flow of endless motion.
sentences.chinese: 我們感到長久的悸動，和永無止境的潮起潮落。

sentences.english: Graduation film of a student from Sichuan. Vagabond child, youthful flutter.
sentences.chinese: 來自四川的學生畢業作品，流浪的孩子，青春的悸動。

sentences.english: The first impulse to write this novel is described as a throb.
sentences.chinese: 寫這本小說的第一衝動就被描繪成悸動。

sentences.english: In the middle of my drowse, I opened my eyes, sensing an unfamiliar stirring.
sentences.chinese: 我睡到一半時睜開眼睛，感覺到一種陌生的悸動。

sentences.english: His temples throbbed with the rush of blood.
sentences.chinese: 隱士血流奔湧，太陽穴隨之悸動。

sentences.english: And I think he's there in that throb.

definition: to have an urge/to be impetuous/impulse/urge
to throb/to pulse/to bounce/to jiggle/to jump about
to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
to miss/to long for/to remember with longing/yearning
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
